rows: {@bold Treachery.} 该人物获得以下缺陷："我只有通过确保我的同伴不能实现他们的目标，才能实现我的目标。"
{@bold Bloodlust.} 该人物获得以下缺陷："我喜欢为杀人而杀人，而且一旦开始，就很难停止。"
{@bold Overwhelming Ambition.} 人物获得以下缺陷："我注定要统治深渊，而我的同伴们是实现这一目的的工具。"
{@bold Demonic Possession.}角色被一个恶魔实体附身，直到被{@spell dispel evil and good}或类似的魔法释放。每当被附身的角色在攻击卷、能力检查或自救动作上掷出1时，恶魔就会控制该角色并决定该角色的行为。在被附身的角色的每个回合结束时，他或她可以做一个DC15的魅力拯救动作。如果成功，该角色将重新获得控制权，直到他或她再次掷出1。

table.caption: Who Created It or Was Intended to Use It?
rows: 畸变。这个东西是由古代的畸变者创造的，可能是为了给受宠的人形王族使用。当从眼角看到时，这个东西似乎在移动。
人类。该物品是在一个堕落的人类王国的全盛时期创造的，或者它与一个传奇的人类有关。它可能保存着一种被遗忘的语言的文字，或者是一些意义已经消失在时代中的符号。
天人合一。该武器是正常重量的一半，刻有羽翼、太阳和其他善的象征。恶魔发现该物品的存在令人厌恶。
龙。这件物品是由龙脱落的鳞片和爪子制成的。也许它融入了龙的囤积物中的贵重金属和宝石。当它在龙的120英尺范围内时，会略微变暖。
鸦人。该物品是正常重量的一半。它是黑色的，上面刻有蜘蛛和网，以纪念洛尔思。如果暴露在阳光下1分钟或更长时间，它可能会运作不良，或者瓦解。
矮人。该物品经久耐用，并在其设计中加入了矮人符文。它可能与一个希望看到它回归祖先殿堂的部族有关。
空气元素。该物品是正常重量的一半，感觉是空心的。如果它是由织物制成的，它是透明的。
土元素。这件物品可能是用石头制作的。任何布或皮革元素都镶有精细打磨的岩石。
火元素。这件物品触感温暖，任何金属部分都是由黑铁制成的。火焰的符号覆盖在其表面。红色和橙色的阴影是突出的颜色。
水元素。有光泽的鱼鳞代替了皮革或布，而金属部分则是由贝壳和加工过的珊瑚制作而成，其硬度与任何金属一样。
精灵。该物品是正常重量的一半。它装饰着自然界的符号：树叶、藤蔓、星星等等。
费伊人。该物品由最好的材料精制而成，在月光下发出淡淡的光芒，在5英尺的范围内发出昏暗的光，该物品中的任何金属都是银或密特拉，而不是铁或钢。
恶魔。该物品由刻有符文的黑铁或牛角制成，任何布或皮革部件都是由恶魔的皮制成的。它触感温暖，表面上刻有淫秽的面孔或邪恶的符文。天人发现这东西的存在令人厌恶。
巨人。该物品比正常的要大，是由巨人制作的，供他们的小型盟友使用。
地精。该物品的制作看起来很普通，它可能看起来很破旧。它也可能包含齿轮和机械部件，即使这些对物品的功能来说并不重要。
亡灵。该物品结合了死亡的意象，如骨头和头骨，它可能是由尸体的一部分制作而成。触摸起来感觉很冷

table.caption: What Is a Detail from Its History?
rows: 奥术。这件物品是为一个古老的施法者组织而制作的，上面有该组织的标志。
祸害。这件物品是由某一特定文化或某种生物的敌人创造的。如果该文化或生物还在，他们可能会认出这个物品，并把持有者当作敌人。
英雄主义。一位伟大的英雄曾经挥舞过这件物品。任何熟悉该物品历史的人都期望新主人能做出伟大的事迹。
饰品。该物品是为了纪念一个特殊的场合而制作的。镶嵌的宝石，黄金或铂金，以及金或银的丝线装饰着其表面。
预言。该物品在预言中的特点是：它的持有者注定要在未来的事件中扮演一个关键的角色。其他想扮演这个角色的人可能会试图偷走这个物品，或者想阻止预言实现的人可能会试图杀死这个物品的持有者。
宗教的。这件物品被用于献给某个特定神灵的宗教仪式。它上面有神圣的符号。神的追随者可能会试图说服它的主人将其捐献给神庙，为自己偷取该物品，或者由同一神的牧师或圣骑士来庆祝它的使用。
阴险。这种物品与大屠杀或暗杀等大恶之事有关。它可能有一个名字或与使用它的恶棍密切相关。任何熟悉该物品历史的人都可能以怀疑的态度对待它和它的主人。
权力的象征。这件物品曾经被用作皇室礼服的一部分或作为高级职位的徽章。它的前主人或他的后代可能想要它，或者有人会误以为它的新主人是该物品的合法继承人。
table.name: Special Features; What Is a Detail from Its History?

table.caption: What Minor Property Does It Have
rows: 灯塔。携带者可以使用一个额外的行动，使该物品在10英尺范围内发出亮光，在另外10英尺范围内发出暗光，或者熄灭灯光。
指南针。持剑者可以使用一个动作来了解哪条路是北方。
良心的。当持有此物品的人考虑或进行恶意的行为时，此物品会增强良心上的不安。
Delver。在地下时，持有此物品的人总是知道此物品在地表下的深度，以及通往最近的楼梯、斜坡或其他上行路径的方向。
熠熠生辉。这个项目永远不会变脏。
守护者。该物品对其持有者发出低语警告，如果持有者没有丧失能力，则给予+2的主动性奖励。
和谐的。适应这个项目只需要1分钟。
隐藏的信息。一个信息隐藏在物品的某个地方。它可能只在一年中的某个时间，在某一阶段的月光下，或在某个特定的地点可见。
钥匙。该物品用于解锁容器、密室、保险库或其他入口。
语言。当物品在持有者身上时，持有者可以说并理解DM选择的一种语言。
哨兵。选择一种与该物品的创造者为敌的生物。当这种生物在它周围120英尺范围内时，这个物品会发出微弱的光芒。
唱歌的技巧。每当这个物品被击中或被用来打击敌人时，它的持有者就会听到一首古老歌曲的片段。
奇怪的材料。该物品是由一种奇怪的材料制成的，鉴于其用途，这种材料很奇怪。它的耐久性不受影响。
温和的。携带者在华氏零下20度或华氏120度的温度下不会受到伤害。
牢不可破。该物品不能被打破。必须使用特殊手段来摧毁它。
战争领袖。携带者可以使用一个动作使他或她的声音清晰地传出300英尺，直到携带者的下一个回合结束。
水性的。这个物品可以漂浮在水和其他液体上。它的持有者在力量({@skill Athletics})检查中具有游泳的优势。
邪恶。当持有者有机会以自私或恶毒的方式行事时，该物品会增强持有者这样做的冲动。
幻觉。该物品被赋予了幻象魔法，允许其持有者以微小的方式改变该物品的外观。这种改变不会改变物品的佩戴、携带或挥舞方式，也不会对其其他魔法属性产生影响。例如，佩戴者可以让一件红袍变成蓝色，或者让一枚金戒指看起来像象牙做的。当没有人携带或佩戴时，该物品就会恢复到它的真实面貌。
掷两次，重掷任何额外的20分。

table.caption: What Quirk Does It Have
rows: 幸福的。当拥有该物品时，持有者会感到幸运，并对未来的发展感到乐观。蝴蝶和其他无害的生物可能在物品面前嬉戏。
自信。该物品帮助其持有者感到自信。
贪婪。该物品的持有者会对物质财富着迷。
脆弱。该物品在挥舞、穿戴或激活时，会有轻微的破碎、磨损、断裂或裂纹。这个怪癖对它的属性没有影响，但是如果该物品被大量使用，它就会显得很衰弱。

大声。该物品在使用时发出响亮的声音--如铿锵声、喊叫声或共鸣的锣声。
变态。该物品定期地、随机地以轻微的方式改变其外观。持有者无法控制这些微小的改变，这对物品的使用没有影响。
喃喃自语。该物品咕哝着，喃喃自语。仔细聆听该物品的生物可能会学到一些有用的东西。
痛苦的。在使用该物品时，持有者会经历一次无害的疼痛闪光。
占有性。该物品在第一次挥舞或佩戴时需要调和，并且不允许其持有者调和其他物品。(其他已经与持有者契合的物品仍然如此，直到他们的契合结束）。
厌恶。持有者在接触该物品时感到厌恶，并且在持有该物品时继续感到不舒服。
懒惰。持有此物品的人感到懒散和昏昏欲睡。在与该物品相适应时，持有者需要10小时才能完成一次长时间的休息。

table.caption: Lingering Injuries
rows: {@bold Lose an Eye.} You have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. Magic such as the {@spell regenerate} spell can restore the lost eye. If you have no eyes left after sustaining this injury, you're {@condition blinded}.

{@bold Lose an Arm or a Hand.} You can no longer hold anything with two hands, and you can hold only a single object at a time. Magic such as the {@spell regenerate} spell can restore the lost appendage.

{@bold Lose a Foot or Leg.} Your speed on foot is halved, and you must use a cane or crutch to move unless you have a peg leg or other prosthesis. You fall {@condition prone} after using the Dash action. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks made to balance. Magic such as the {@spell regenerate} spell can restore the lost appendage.

{@bold Limp.} Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after using the Dash action. If you fail the save, you fall {@condition prone}. Magical healing removes the limp.

{@bold Internal Injury.} Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you lose your action and can't use reactions until the start of your next turn. The injury heals if you receive magical healing or if you spend ten days doing nothing but resting.
{@bold Broken Ribs.} This has the same effect as Internal Injury above, except that the save DC is 10.

{@bold Horrible Scar.} You are disfigured to the extent that the wound can't be easily concealed. You have disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks and advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as {@spell heal} and {@spell regenerate}, removes the scar.

{@bold Festering Wound.} Your hit point maximum is reduced by 1 every 24 hours the wound persists. If your hit point maximum drops to 0, you die. The wound heals if you receive magical healing. Alternatively, someone can tend to the wound and make a DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check once every 24 hours. After ten successes, the wound heals.
{@bold Minor Scar.} The scar doesn't have any adverse effect. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as {@spell heal} and {@spell regenerate}, removes the scar.

table.caption: Giant Personality Traits
rows: The brutality of my peers is a relic of a bygone era that should be stamped out. I seek a more enlightened path.
As the most powerful beings in creation, we have a duty to use our strength for the benefit of all.
I take what I want. I don't care who gets hurt.
A giant lives for a few centuries, but giantkind is eternal. Everything I do is to glorify my ancestors and make my descendants proud.
Dragons are my mortal enemies. Everything I do is to ensure their destruction.
I measure a creature's worth by its size. The small folk are beneath my concern.
The small folk are vermin. I enjoy torturing and killing them.
Good or bad, Annam's sons represent the ideals that we, as giants, must strive to uphold.
table.name: Roleplaying a Giant; Giant Personality Traits

table.caption: Giant Ideals
rows: The Ordning. Annam created the ordning for the good of all giants, and it's our duty to uphold his vision. (Lawful)
Skill. What sets my clan apart is its mastery of our traditional crafts. (Good)
Strength. No other race can match the strength of giants, and none should dare to try. (Evil)
Lordship. Giants are the rightful rulers of the world. All will be well when our empire is restored. (Neutral)
Tribute. The lesser races owe giants not just respect but payment of tribute, and what they don't pay willingly, we will take by force. (Chaotic)
Religion. Of Annam's many sons, none is greater than my patron deity. (Any)
table.name: Roleplaying a Giant; Giant Ideals

table.caption: Giant Bonds
rows: My clan is the most important influence on my life, our collective place in the ordning depends on our devotion to one another.
My clan mates who serve in our deity's temples are the closest companions I'll ever know.
My place in the ordning is ordained by our patron deity, and it would be blasphemous to aspire to anything higher or lower.
Though I can never rise above my clan's position in the ordning, I can be a leader among my clan.
My own kind have turned their backs on me, so I make my way among the lesser creatures of the world.
Humans have proven their worth in the world and earned a measure of respect from giantkind.
table.name: Roleplaying a Giant; Giant Bonds

table.caption: Giant Flaws
rows: The ordning is too restrictive for the likes of me.
The lesser creatures of the world have no souls
Unity among giants is a myth, anyone not of my clan is a fair target for my weapons.
I care nothing for what others expect, to the point where I cannot help but contradict what others ask of me.
I am terrified of arcane magic and can be cowed by overt displays of it.
Ancient dragons fill me with dread. My knees grow weak in their presence.
table.name: Roleplaying a Giant; Giant Flaws

I laugh at my own jokes-the darker, the better.
I never volunteer information, and I respond only to questions.
I offer generous terms in my deals, but the cost for defaulting is exceedingly high.
I require all of my bargains to be put in writing and signed in the other party's blood.
I am very superstitious, and I see omens in every event and action around me.
table.name: Roleplaying a Hag; Hag Personality Traits

table.caption: Hag Ideals
rows: Change. I will metamorphose into every kind of hag and live a century as each, becoming something even greater in the end. (Chaotic)
Community. Loneliness is the path to madness. That is why I have minions to keep me company. (Lawful)
Greed. I will acquire the rarest and most valuable holy treasures to keep them from being used for good. (Evil)
Independence. I neither require nor want a coven. I will not be someone's equal. (Neutral)
Power. I will become an auntie or a grandmother, even if I have to kill my own mother to do it. (Evil)
Ugliness. I want to be envied for my appearance and my cruel heart. (Evil)
table.name: Roleplaying a Hag; Hag Ideals

table.caption: Hag Bonds
rows: I hate a certain mortal family and steal one of their children each generation for my own purposes.
I am involved in a centuries-long feud with a rival of similar power and status.
My house holds everything that I hold dear. I can't abide visitors who threaten my hearth and home.
I owe a great favor to a hag grandmother.
I traded away something before I realized it was priceless, and now I want it back.
My daughter was taken from me, and I want to find her and train her.
My greatest rival and I know a secret word that will destroy both of us simultaneously.
The ones who looted and burned my home will pay for their offense.
table.name: Roleplaying a Hag; Hag Bonds

table.caption: Hag Flaws
rows: I am too eager for gossip.
I can't resist flirting with a handsome man.
I have an allergy to a creature (such as cats or ravens) or a substance (such as apples or blood) that is important to my work.
I will not tell a lie, but I can still say nothing, nod suggestively, or bend the truth a little to suit my needs.
I am greatly weakened on the nights of the full moon.
I can't resist a clever riddle.
table.name: Roleplaying a Hag; Hag Flaws

table.caption: Servants
rows: {@dice 2d4} {@creature swarm of insects||swarms of insects} or {@creature swarm of rats||swarms of rats}
table.name: Random Hag Minions; Servants

table.caption: Hag Objects
rows: The eye of a cleric, preserved in a liquid-filled jar. When an undead creature comes within 100 feet of the jar, the eye darts about as if it is looking around in a panic. It otherwise remains motionless.
The leathery, preserved head of a dwarf. Anyone who holds its 5-foot-long beard can see through its eyes.
A perfectly smooth, round stone the size of a human's fist. If placed on the ground, it rolls 20 feet per round toward the nearest source of fresh water.
A sickly crow with clipped wings. The only sound it can make is to roar like a lion.
A seemingly empty, sealed jar. If opened, the person standing closest to the jar suddenly recalls {@dice 1d6} happy memories from the life of a long dead elf lord.
A seemingly mundane gold piece. Anyone who touches it gains the unshakable belief that this is the very first gold coin minted by humanity.

A black box, 3 feet on each side. Anyone who opens it finds a set of three wooden, articulated figures that are modeled after three members of the adventuring party. If the figures are stood on the ground, they act out insulting parodies of their duplicates' recent actions.
An oval-shaped disc made of an unknown metal. If it is tossed in the air, it flies in circles around the tosser for a minute, tiny lights winking on its surface, before settling to the ground nearby.

A thick, dusty tome, every page filled with tiny, barely legible writing. Careful study of the book reveals it to be a written transcript of every conversation that took place over the course of a year, three years ago, in a nearby village.
A small painting that depicts a placid field. Just after midnight each day, the painting changes to depict the following day's weather.
table.name: One-of-a-Kind Objects; Hag Objects

table.caption: Mind Flayer Personality Traits
rows: I never let pass an opportunity to show my contempt for lesser beings.
I like to flavor my meals by engendering positive emotions in my victims before feeding on them.
So as not to taint my thoughts, I avoid telepathically communicating with lesser beings when possible.
I never eat unless the victim is conscious and aware.
I'm very picky. I feed only on the brains of a specific kind of humanoid.
I'm curious about how other races live and how their societies function.
I'm curious about the limits of other creatures' intelligence and devise situations to test them.
table.name: Roleplaying a Mind Flayer; Mind Flayer Personality Traits

table.caption: Mind Flayer Ideals
rows: Knowledge. All information is of value. (Neutral)
Obedience. Nothing is more important than following orders. (Lawful)
Selfishness. I do my best work when motivated by my own self-interest. (Chaotic)
Truth. Truth is the foundation of knowledge, so I never lie. (Lawful)
Superiority. Nothing can be gained from the study of lesser beings. (Neutral)
Domination. All others should submit to my control. (Evil)
table.name: Roleplaying a Mind Flayer; Mind Flayer Ideals

table.caption: Mind Flayer Bonds
rows: I think the elder brain is wrong about something, and I want to convince it.
I have a secret I wish to keep even from other mind flayers.
The more the colony grows, the more powerful we all become.
Nothing is more important than rebuilding our lost empire.
Persistence of my colony is the greatest good.
I have important research that must be protected at all costs.
table.name: Roleplaying a Mind Flayer; Mind Flayer Bonds

table.caption: Mind Flayer Flaws
rows: I am oblivious to the emotions expressed by others.
I believe my minions will always do precisely as I intend.
I never assume others understand and always explain everything.
I have a memory that isn't mine. I'm obsess about it.
It is inconceivable that another creature could outsmart me.
I sometimes confuse others' thoughts with my own.
table.name: Roleplaying a Mind Flayer; Mind Flayer Flaws

table.caption: Orc Personality Traits
rows: I welcome any chance to prove my battle skills.
I always appear like I am about to kill everyone around me.
I drink the blood of monsters to consume their power.
I chant orcish war dirges during combat.
table.name: Roleplaying an Orc; Orc Personality Traits

table.caption: Orc Ideals
rows: Strength. Showing superior strength brings honor to Gruumsh. (Any)
Prowess. Killing all your enemies is the path to greatness. (Evil)
Dominance. I will have achieved glory when all cower before my might. (Evil)
Intimidation. I can get what I want from weaklings that fear me. (Evil)
Glory. The goals of the tribe don't concern me. Personal glory is what I crave. (Chaotic)
Savagery. I will not be controlled. (Chaotic)
table.name: Roleplaying an Orc; Orc Ideals

table.caption: Orc Bonds
rows: I will defend my tribe to the death.
Every serious choice I make must be decided by signs or omens from the gods.
I carry the teeth of a great warrior. They inspire me to commit great deeds in battle.
To avenge Gruumsh, I will kill every elf I see.
I will seek and destroy those who murdered my tribe.
I owe my survival to a non-orc.
table.name: Roleplaying an Orc; Orc Bonds

table.caption: Orc Flaws
rows: I have a calm temperament and let insults roll off my back.
I don't fear the gods and have no patience for superstitions.
I am slow to anger, but when I do become enraged I fight until my enemies are dead, no matter the cost.
I understand the value of civilization and the order that society brings.
I believe in living to fight another day.
table.name: Roleplaying an Orc; Orc Flaws

table.caption: Yuan-ti Personality Traits
rows: I see omens in every event and action. The serpent gods continue to advise us.
I have very high standards for food, drink, and physical pleasures.
I prefer to be alone rather than among other creatures, including my own kind.
I sometimes become consumed by philosophy.
I believe I am superior to others of my caste.
I am driven by wanderlust and want to explore lands far from our cities.
I am interested in modern human culture, even as primitive as it is.
I await the day when we again conquer lands by force, as we did in the old times.
table.name: Roleplaying a Yuan-ti; Yuan-ti Personality Traits

table.caption: Yuan-ti Ideals
rows: Greed. I display my wealth as a sign of my power and prosperity. (Evil)
Aspiration. I strive to follow the path toward becoming an anathema. (Evil)
Unity. No leader shall put personal goals above those of our race. (Any)
Kinship. My allegiance is to my caste and my city. Other settlements can burn for all I care. (Any)
Inspiration. My actions set an example for the lesser castes to emulate. (Any)
Power. Everything I choose to do is determined by whether it will make me smarter and stronger. (Evil)
table.name: Roleplaying a Yuan-ti; Yuan-ti Ideals

table.caption: Yuan-ti Bonds
rows: I will see our empire rise again and, in so doing, win the favor of the serpent gods.
I am enamored with the culture and trappings of another society and wish to be part of it.
I respect my superiors and obey them without question. My fate is theirs to decide.
I have an interest in an unsuitable mate, which I can't suppress.
I respect and emulate a great hero or ancestor.
An enemy destroyed something of value to me, and I will find where it lives and kill the offender.
table.name: Roleplaying a Yuan-ti; Yuan-ti Bonds

table.caption: Yuan-ti Flaws
rows: I feel twinges of emotion, and it shames me that I am imperfect in this way.
I put too much credence in the dictates of a particular god.
I frequently overindulge in food and wine, and I am impaired and lethargic for days afterward.
I secretly believe things would be better if I was in charge.
If I could get away with it, I would gladly kill and eat a superior yuan-ti.
table.name: Roleplaying a Yuan-ti; Yuan-ti Flaws

table.caption: Life Events
rows: You suffered a tragedy. Roll on the Tragedies table.
You gained a bit of good fortune. Roll on the Boons table.
You fell in love or got married. If you get this result more than once, you can choose to have a child instead. Work with your DM to determine the identity of your love interest.

You made an enemy of an adventurer. Roll a {@dice d6}. An odd number indicates you are to blame for the rift, and an even number indicates you are blameless. Use the supplemental tables and work with your DM to determine this hostile character's identity and the danger this enemy poses to you.
You made a friend of an adventurer. Use the supplemental tables and work with your DM to add more detail to this friendly character and establish how your friendship began.
You spent time working in a job related to your background. Start the game with an extra {@dice 2d6} gp.

You met someone important. Use the supplemental tables to determine this character's identity and how this individual feels about you. Work out additional details with your DM as needed to fit this character into your backstory.
You went on an adventure. Roll on the Adventures table to see what happened to you. Work with your DM to determine the nature of the adventure and the creatures you encountered.
You had a supernatural experience. Roll on the Supernatural Events table to find out what it was.

You fought in a battle. Roll on the War table to learn what happened to you. Work with your DM to come up with the reason for the battle and the factions involved. It might have been a small conflict between your community and a band of orcs, or it could have been a major battle in a larger war.
You committed a crime or were wrongly accused of doing so. Roll on the Crime table to determine the nature of the offense and on the Punishment table to see what became of you.
You encountered something magical. Roll on the Arcane Matters table.
Something truly strange happened to you. Roll on the Weird Stuff table.
table.name: Life Events

table.caption: Adventures
rows: You nearly died. You have nasty scars on your body, and you are missing an ear, {@dice 1d3} fingers, or {@dice 1d4} toes.
You suffered a grievous injury. Although the wound healed, it still pains you from time to time.
You were wounded, but in time you fully recovered.
You contracted a disease while exploring a filthy warren. You recovered from the disease, but you have a persistent cough, pockmarks on your skin, or prematurely gray hair.
You were poisoned by a trap or a monster. You recovered, but the next time you must make a saving throw against poison, you make the saving throw with disadvantage.
You lost something of sentimental value to you during your adventure. Remove one trinket from your possessions.
You were terribly frightened by something you encountered and ran away, abandoning your companions to their fate.
You learned a great deal during your adventure. The next time you make an ability check or a saving throw, you have advantage on the roll.
You found some treasure on your adventure. You have {@dice 2d6} gp left from your share of it.
You found a considerable amount of treasure on your adventure. You have {@dice 1d20+50} gp left from your share of it.
You came across a common magic item (of the DM's choice).
table.name: Secondary Tables; Adventures

table.caption: Arcane Matters
rows: You were {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by a spell.
You were injured by the effect of a spell.
You witnessed a powerful spell being cast by a cleric, a druid, a sorcerer, a warlock, or a wizard.
You drank a potion (of the DM's choice).
You found a spell scroll (of the DM's choice) and succeeded in casting the spell it contained.
You were affected by teleportation magic.
You turned {@condition invisible} for a time.
You identified an illusion for what it was.
You saw a creature being conjured by magic.
Your fortune was read by a diviner. Roll twice on the Life Events table, but don't apply the results. Instead, the DM picks one event as a portent of your future (which might or might not come true).
table.name: Secondary Tables; Arcane Matters

table.caption: Boons
rows: A friendly wizard gave you a spell scroll containing one cantrip (of the DM's choice).

You saved the life of a commoner, who now owes you a life debt. This individual accompanies you on your travels and performs mundane tasks for you, but will leave if neglected, abused, or imperiled. Determine details about this character by using the supplemental tables and working with your DM.
You found some money. You have {@dice 1d20} gp in addition to your regular starting funds.
A relative bequeathed you a simple weapon of your choice.
You found something interesting. You gain one additional trinket.
You once performed a service for a local temple. The next time you visit the temple, you can receive healing up to your hit point maximum.
A friendly alchemist gifted you with a potion of healing or a flask of acid, as you choose.

A distant relative left you a stipend that enables you to live at the comfortable lifestyle for {@dice 1d20} years. If you choose to live at a higher lifestyle, you reduce the price of the lifestyle by 2 gp during that time period.
table.name: Secondary Tables; Boons

table.caption: Punishment
rows: You did not commit the crime and were exonerated after being accused.
You committed the crime or helped do so, but nonetheless the authorities found you not guilty.
You were nearly caught in the act. You had to flee and are wanted in the community where the crime occurred.
You were caught and convicted. You spent time in jail, chained to an oar, or performing hard labor. You served a sentence of {@dice 1d4} years or succeeded in escaping after that much time.
table.name: Secondary Tables; Punishment

table.caption: Supernatural Events
rows: You were ensorcelled by a fey and enslaved for {@dice 1d6} years before you escaped.
You saw a demon and ran away before it could do anything to you.

A devil tempted you. Make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, your alignment shifts one step toward evil (if it's not evil already), and you start the game with an additional {@dice 1d20+50} gp.
You woke up one morning miles from your home, with no idea how you got there.
You visited a holy site and felt the presence of the divine there.
You witnessed a falling red star, a face appearing in the frost, or some other bizarre happening. You are certain that it was an omen of some sort.
You escaped certain death and believe it was the intervention of a god that saved you.
You explored an empty house and found it to be haunted.
You were briefly possessed. Roll a {@dice d6} to determine what kind of creature possessed you: 1, celestial; 2, devil; 3, demon; 4, fey; 5, elemental; 6, undead.
You saw a ghoul feeding on a corpse.
A Celestial or Fiend visited you in your dreams to give a warning of dangers to come.
You briefly visited the Feywild or Shadowfell.
You saw a portal that you believe leads to another plane of existence.
table.name: Secondary Tables; Supernatural Events

table.caption: Tragedies
rows: A family member or a close friend died. Roll on the Cause of Death supplemental table to find out how.
A friendship ended bitterly, and the other person is now hostile to you. The cause might have been a misunderstanding or something you or the former friend did.
You lost all your possessions in a disaster, and you had to rebuild your life.
You were imprisoned for a crime you didn't commit and spent {@dice 1d6} years at hard labor, in jail, or shackled to an oar in a slave galley.
War ravaged your home community, reducing everything to rubble and ruin. In the aftermath, you either helped your town rebuild or moved somewhere else.
A lover disappeared without a trace. You have been looking for that person ever since.
A terrible blight in your home community caused crops to fail, and many starved. You lost a sibling or some other family member.

You did something that brought terrible shame to you in the eyes of your family. You might have been involved in a scandal, dabbled in dark magic, or offended someone important. The attitude of your family members toward you becomes indifferent at best, though they might eventually forgive you.
For a reason you were never told, you were exiled from your community. You then either wandered in the wilderness for a time or promptly found a new place to live.
A romantic relationship ended. Roll a {@dice d6}. An odd number means it ended with bad feelings, while an even number means it ended amicably.

A current or prospective romantic partner of yours died. Roll on the Cause of Death supplemental table to find out how. If the result is murder, roll a {@dice d12}. On a 1, you were responsible, whether directly or indirectly.
table.name: Secondary Tables; Tragedies

table.caption: War
rows: You were knocked out and left for dead. You woke up hours later with no recollection of the battle.
You were badly injured in the fight, and you still bear the awful scars of those wounds.
You ran away from the battle to save your life, but you still feel shame for your cowardice.
You suffered only minor injuries, and the wounds all healed without leaving scars.
You survived the battle, but you suffer from terrible nightmares in which you relive the experience.
You escaped the battle unscathed, though many of your friends were injured or lost.
You acquitted yourself well in battle and are remembered as a hero. You might have received a medal for your bravery.
table.name: Secondary Tables; War

You were taken captive by a race of evil humanoids such as drow, kuo-toa, or quaggoths. You lived as a slave in the Underdark until you escaped.

You met a demigod, an archdevil, an archfey, a demon lord, or a titan, and you lived to tell the tale.

rows: 活动开始时，角色们都被俘虏了，无论是黄昏军团的囚犯、海盗船上的俘虏，还是被困在丛林的陷阱里。

这些人物都在丛林中无望地迷失了方向。
人物所在派别的领导人命令他们合作完成一项秘密任务。

一个神奇的或自然的现象威胁着伊萨兰的所有居民。

table.name: Four Peoples, One Party

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Nation.} The invaders must be driven out and the ancient capital of Orazca reclaimed.
{@b Glory.} I wish to earn great glory in battle—ideally, by making my foes surrender.
{@b Poetry.} Beauty is to be found in all things, from creation to destruction, and it should all be recorded in words.
{@b Zeal.} I am devoted to the Threefold Sun and the commands of the priests.
{@b History.} I seek to understand the empire's history so I can better chart a course for its future.
{@b Peace.} I would like to believe that peace can be forged among the peoples of this land.
table.name: Sun Empire; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I left behind a family (living or dead) when I set out on my journey of exploration.
I have ties to the imperial line.
I come from a noble family, and have kin who live as hostages in the imperial capital.
I have fallen in love with a member of a pirate crew.
I discovered an ancient ruin in the jungle, but I keep it a secret.
I will one day find the Immortal Sun and restore the empire's ancient glory
table.name: Sun Empire; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Harmony.}. The peoples of this world should strive for the same harmony that exists between air and water.
{@b  Nature.} In the midst of war, it is often the forest that suffers most—unless we protect it.
{@b  Knowledge.} True understanding of one's self and the world is the highest good.
{@b Reverence.} The wisdom of the shamans and elders is our best guide in the world.
{@b  Cleverness.} The best way to defeat your opponents is to outsmart them.
{@b  Defense.} The golden city must remain hidden, and its power kept from those who would abuse it.
table.name: River Heralds; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I have carried on secret trade with a Sun Empire merchant for years now.
I am related to the shaman of my band.
I am fascinated by the culture and beliefs of the strangers in our land.
A small tributary to the Great River is in my care, and I will do anything to defend it.
I aspire to become the leader of my band—either as a shaman, or by supplanting the shaman as a war leader.
I will one day find the Immortal Sun and use its power to drive the invaders from our land.
table.name: River Heralds; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Conquest.} The destiny of my people is to rule the world.
{@b Order.} The purpose of our conquest is to establish law and order in the lands we rule.
{@b Devotion.} Following the tenets of the church is the only way to earn eternal life in the coming age of ever-flowing blood.
{@b Slaughter.} I love the feeling of warm blood running down my chin.
{@b Glory.} Those who prove their worth in battle will win eternal life.
Strength. In life as in war, the stronger force wins.
table.name: Paladin; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: My family has been feuding with another noble family for seven hundred years.
I became friends with a merfolk shaman I captured.
I am a knight of the Bloodstained order, and have forsaken all other bonds since the day I slaughtered my own family.
I carry a relic of one of the vampire saints known as the Venerables, counting it as my dearest possession.
I would do anything for the soldiers in my company.
I will one day find the Immortal Sun and use its power to supplant the queen.
table.name: Paladin; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Freedom.} The sea is the freedom to go anywhere and do anything.
{@b Knowledge.} I'm as greedy for secrets and lore as others are for treasure.
{@b Pillage.} It's not the having, it's the taking that shows who's strongest.
{@b Crew.} I'm committed to my crewmates, not to ideals.
{@b Coalition.} I believe we're not just stronger but also better when we join forces in unity.
table.name: Wizard; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: My captain is dearer to me than any other person or possession.
My greatest dream is to return across the sea to the land my ancestors left.
I abandoned a child to be fostered in a city somewhere.
I was shipwrecked on an island with a vampire, and we became good friends.
I buried a great treasure somewhere. . . and lost the map.
I have one piece of a treasure map, and no idea where the other pieces are.
table.name: Wizard; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: White Personality Traits
rows: I can find common ground with even the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
If someone is in trouble, I'm always ready to lend aid.
I get overly upset when people break even minor rules.
I am honest to the point of being blunt or rude.
I go into every situation with at least one backup plan, but I can get lost when my plans go awry.
I have no patience for selfish or greedy people.
I like my environment to be well ordered and clean.
table.name: White Personality Traits

table.caption: White Ideals
rows: {@b Harmony.} I long for a world in which everyone gets along.
{@b Community.} It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community and the security of civilization.
{@b Peace.} It is each person's responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole community.
{@b Solidarity.} Working together, we are stronger than any of us alone.
{@b Law and Order.} We all must obey those in authority and follow laws, or society will devolve into chaos.
{@b Honor.} If I dishonor myself, I undermine the foundation of my community.
table.name: White Ideals

table.caption: Blue Personality Traits
rows: I employ a polysyllabic vocabulary that conveys the impression of tremendous erudition.
I'm used to helping out those who aren't as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.
I often get lost in my own thoughts and contemplation, becoming oblivious to my surroundings.
I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right. I can't help it—I'm a perfectionist.
I want to know how things work and what makes people act as they do.
There's nothing I like more than a good mystery.
Messing up just means an opportunity to learn from my mistakes.
There's no need to rush into action; I prefer to plan before I act.
table.name: Blue Personality Traits

table.caption: Blue Ideals
rows: {@b Perfection.} The goal of a life of study is to constantly improve oneself.
{@b Education.} Information can change the world only when it is widely shared.
{@b Knowledge.} The path to power and self-improvement comes through mastery of what can be known.
{@b Change.} The world is in constant flux, and we must be ready to change with it.
{@b Logic.} Emotions must not cloud our clear thinking.
{@b Self-Knowledge.} If you know yourself, there's nothing left to know.
table.name: Blue Ideals

table.caption: Black Personality Traits
rows: The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it. 2 If you do me an injury, I will crush you, ruin your name, and salt your family's lands for all time.
The first thing I do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable—or where such things might be hidden.
I get bitter if I'm not the center of attention.
I can't stand the dangerous idiots who deny their own needs in order to help others. It's often difficult to motivate them to do what I want.
If others won't do things when you ask nicely, stop asking nicely.
Inspiring fear can be the most effective way to motivate people.
I don't care about morality or taboos—only results. I'll do whatever it takes to get the results I want.
table.name: Black Personality Traits

table.caption: Black Ideals
rows: {@b Power.} Power is the only way to guarantee your ability to control your life—and thus your happiness.
{@b Self-Interest.} If I don't look out for myself, no one else is going to.
Strength. Helping the weak is merely delaying their inevitable failure.
{@b Freedom.} If I need something, I'm a fool if I let laws or morality stand in my way.
{@b Greed.} The clearest way to get ahead in this world is with money.
{@b Independence.} No one tells me what to do.
table.name: Black Ideals

table.caption: Red Personality Traits
rows: I always speak and act before I think.
My changing emotions dominate my personality, leaving no one in any doubt about what I'm feeling.
I fall in and out of love faster than the weather changes.
I either love something or I hate it; there is no in-between.
I'm always working on some piece of art to express my feelings.
I revel in the storms and the destruction that give expression to the turmoil inside me.
I have no patience for people who think they can boss others around.
table.name: Red Personality Traits

table.caption: Red Ideals
rows: {@b Freedom.} Everyone should be free to pursue their own dreams.
{@b Emotion.} My heart tells me what it needs. All I have to do is listen and act accordingly.
{@b Adventure.} Life is an adventure, and it's up to each individual to experience it.
{@b Relationships.} Part of life is embracing the passion, loyalty, and camaraderie that ties us to others.
{@b Creativity.} The world is in need of new ideas and bold action.
{@b Sincerity.} No one should pretend to be something they're not.
table.name: Red Ideals

table.caption: Green Personality Traits
rows: I'm sharply attuned to the cycles of nature, and can almost feel the pull of the full moon.
My instincts never lead me astray.
I get along better with animals than I do with most people.
There is more wisdom in a forest pool than in any library.
Beasts of the wild have no need for manners, and neither do I.
Nothing raises my ire like seeing people treat life as disposable.
I can identify hundreds of bird species by their songs.
I see omens in every ripple, gust of wind, and flight of birds.
table.name: Green Personality Traits

table.caption: Green Ideals
rows: {@b Acceptance.} Things are as they are for a reason, and it's foolish to try to change them.
{@b Nature.} The natural world is more important than the constructs of civilization.
{@b Potential.} The secret to happiness is to find one's place in the natural order and embrace it.
{@b Interdependence.} My role is deeply connected to the web of life, and my actions have consequences for everyone around me.
{@b Live and Let Live.} Ideals aren't worth killing or going to war for.
{@b History.} Only through studying the past can we avoid repeating past mistakes.
table.name: Green Ideals

table.caption: Layers and Rulers of the Nine Hells
table.name: Lords of the Nine; Layers and Rulers of the Nine Hells

table.caption: Demon Personality Traits
rows: I fawn over others to make my betrayal more unexpected.
I crush those I can defeat, and lie in wait to weaken and overwhelm those I must respect.
I will do anything to survive. Anything.
Someday all will worship me. Until then, I track their insults with obsessive attention.
table.name: Demon Customization Tables; Demon Personality Traits

table.caption: Demon Ideals
rows: Self-Preservation. It's everything and everyone for themselves in this cruel world.
Might. The world is divided into the strong who rule and the weak who obey or die.
Cunning. Always have a backup plan ready, especially if it involves betraying someone.
Strength. Strength is the one coin accepted in all realms and by all folk.
Ambition. We reach the station in the cosmos that we deserve due to our drive and talents.
Cruelty. Strength without regular demonstrations of its potential is an empty weapon.
table.name: Demon Customization Tables; Demon Ideals

table.caption: Demon Bonds
rows: I am a perfect product of creation, destined to one day shape the cosmos to my whims. Everything I do verifies my destiny.
table.name: Demon Customization Tables; Demon Bonds

table.caption: Demon Flaws
rows: I act based on instinct, rarely with a plan.
I am cowed by threats, and even preposterous ones make me pause.
Deep down, I know I am doomed to anonymity.
My natural inclination is to grovel and beg for the favor of those stronger than me.
I rage, but I use anger to distract from my fear of confrontation.
I become entangled and betrayed by my own machinations.
table.name: Demon Customization Tables; Demon Flaws

table.caption: Unusual Demon Features
rows: Belches Flies. Once per day, the demon can use an action to belch enough flies to create an effect as though it cast fog cloud.
Tiny Wings. The demon gains a flying speed of 10 feet. If it could already fly, its flying speed becomes 10 feet.
Ever-Open Extra Eye. The demon gains advantage on Perception checks related to sight.

Bleeds Wasps. The first time in each combat the demon is reduced to half its hit points or less, a {@creature swarm of wasps||swarm of insects (wasps)} forms around it. The swarm considers creatures other than the demon to be enemies.
Extra Arm. The demon gains advantage on Sleight of Hand checks.
Enormous Ears. The demon gains advantage on Perception checks to hear sounds.
Silver Bones. The demon's natural weapons are considered silvered.
Snake Hair. Creatures that grapple the demon or are grappled by it are poisoned until the grapple ends.
Endlessly Mumbling Second Mouth. The demon suffers disadvantage on Stealth checks against creatures that can hear.
Huge Feet. The demon suffers disadvantage on Stealth, Athletics, and Acrobatics checks when they involve moving its feet.
Translucent Skin. The demon's skin is slimy and translucent. It has advantage on attempts to escape a grapple.
Oily Boils. Each time the demon takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, the area within 5 feet of it becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3} until the end of the demon's next turn.
Thick Lead Skull. The demon can't use telepathy or be contacted by telepathy. It can't be charmed, frightened, or stunned.
Worm Tongue. The demon can't speak any language.
Head Hands. The demon has heads where its hands should be and uses the heads' mouths to manipulate objects. If the demon had claw attacks, they become bite attacks that deal piercing damage.
Blimp Body. The demon can float at will as if under the effect of the levitate spell (no concentration required). While it has half its hit points or less, it loses this ability.
Immaterial. The demon has resistance to all damage except psychic damage, and all damage it deals is halved.
Long Arms. The demon's reach is 5 feet longer than normal.
Eyeless. The demon is blind. It has blindsight with a radius of 60 feet.
Vestigial Demon. A miniature vestigial twin of the demon grows from its body. The demon can't be blinded, deafened, or stunned.
table.name: Demon Customization Tables; Unusual Demon Features

table.caption: Cult Goals
rows: Political power, control over the local area
The death of a hated enemy or rival
Control of a guild or similar institution
Recovery of an artifact or magic item that could prove useful in the Blood War
Revenge for an insult, wrong, or past defeat
Personal power and comfort for its leaders
table.name: Fiendish Cults; Cult Goals

table.caption: Cult Resources
rows: The cult uses a respectable guild, business, or institution as a front.
The cult thrives through the support of generations of a powerful noble family.
The cult controls the local officers of the law.
The cult has access to a cache of powerful magic.
The cult can open a direct portal to the Outer Planes, allowing fiends to intercede on their behalf.
The cult's leader is a renegade fiend seeking to evade its enemies.
table.name: Fiendish Cults; Cult Resources

table.caption: Cult Organization
rows: Conspiracy. Members use passwords and double-blind communication.
False Front. The cult puts on an elaborate deception to appear as a harmless civic group.
Criminal Enterprise. The cult is organized through a thieves' guild.
Network. The cult has a secret alliance of members who have infiltrated the lower ranks of every organization of note in the region.
Cult of Personality. The cult leader is a beloved figure renowned for great, benevolent deeds.
Entrenched. The cult is part of the local culture, a tradition that established decades ago and kept secret from outsiders.
table.name: Fiendish Cults; Cult Organization

table.caption: Cult Hardship
rows: The cult is wracked with infighting.
A rival cult strives to destroy this group and replace it.
The cult struggles to rein in its dark, violent impulses in order to remain undetected.
Murder and betrayal leads to a constant turnover in cult leadership.
The cult leader is a figurehead. The real power is a crime lord behind the scenes.
The cult is a disposable pawn manipulated by its master.
table.name: Fiendish Cults; Cult Hardship

table.caption: Elf (Non-drow) Adventurer Story Hooks
rows: You believe the key to reuniting the elves with Corellon lies somewhere in the wider world, not within elven society, and you're determined to find it.
Your sibling was killed by a rampaging monster. You won't rest until you track it down and slay it.
A raven brought you a cryptic message from an old friend who needs your help, but the message was vague about the friend's location. You're trying to follow a years-old trail and save your friend.
A beautiful elf won your heart, then broke it. If you earn enough gold and glory by adventuring, perhaps you can win back your love.
Your father thought you too weak to survive as an adventurer, but he's wrong, and you'll prove it.
Only those who perform great deeds are remembered long after their death. Bards will honor your exploits for generations to come.
You're secretly in love with one of the other members of your adventuring group, and you can't bear the thought of any harm befalling that person.
When you were born, your grandmother prophesied you would one day rule a human kingdom. You've gone in search of that destiny.
table.name: Elf Tables; Elf (Non-drow) Adventurer Story Hooks

table.caption: Drow Adventurer Story Hooks
rows: You overheard members of your own house plotting to poison you, so you fled from the Underdark to save yourself. You won't return until you've amassed enough fortune to surround yourself with loyal mercenary bodyguards.
You were enslaved as punishment for trying to poison an influential rival, but you escaped and fled to the surface. If you return to the Underdark and are captured, you'll be re-enslaved.
You were the lover of a high-ranking priestess of Lolth as a means of enhancing your status. When she tired of you, the loss of status was humiliating, so you left.

You killed a drow from a more powerful house in a duel over a public insult. The slain drow's house vowed to destroy your house unless you were handed over. Your kin urged you to leave the Underdark. You wonder what became of them.

A close friend of yours was revealed to be a worshiper of Eilistraee. Suspicion fell on everyone in her circle. Running was a tacit admission of guilt, even though you knew nothing about it, but you'd have been sacrificed to Lolth if you stayed.

You were among a group of surface raiders that was ambushed, and you were captured. During years of captivity, you learned that most of what Lolth's priestesses taught about the outer world was lies. Now you're experiencing the truth for yourself.

All your life, you were alienated and terrified by the cruelty of your kin. The first chance you got, you volunteered to go on a surface raid, then deserted the group and remained behind. Now you're hated and feared wherever you go, but at least you've found a small group of adventurous friends who trust and support each other.

You were part of a delegation carrying diplomatic messages to another drow city when duergar attacked the caravan for slaves and treasure. Only you and one other guard escaped. If you'd returned home, you'd have been poisoned or worse for failure. Becoming a mercenary was your best option.
table.name: Elf Tables; Drow Adventurer Story Hooks

table.caption: Dwarf Adventurer Story Hooks
rows: You were accused of stealing a fellow artisan's item and claiming it as your work. Innocent or guilty, you were made an outcast.
Your wanderlust prompted you to shirk your duties as a crafter in favor of wandering the world. Your clan isn't pleased with this choice.
You became separated from your clan due to an earthquake, a drow slave raid, or similar event and hope to return home.
You were assigned to become a merchant by the priests of Moradin and have yet to forgive them for their mistake. You should be working a forge, not wandering the outside world!
You are a spy, traveling incognito to gather information for the clan elders.
You struggle to resist the lure of Abbathor, but can't hold it at bay. Better to walk the world and sate your greed on non-dwarves.
table.name: Dwarves in the World; Dwarf Adventurer Story Hooks

table.caption: Dwarf Quirks
rows: Water from the sky! It always surprises you.
You have a fascination with the ocean and its chaos.
Any creature larger than a human makes you nervous.
You prefer to travel with a parasol or similar item that puts a comforting shelter over your head.
You prefer to sleep during the day.
You speak Common or any other non-dwarf language only if you must.
For you, relaxation is putting in a day at the forge.
You avoid contact with other dwarves, since you mistrust those who would leave their strongholds.
table.name: Dwarves in the World; Dwarf Quirks

table.caption: Duergar Adventurer Story Hooks
rows: You are a heretic, drawn to worship of Moradin.
Caught stealing, you escaped imprisonment but not before torture left you with a scar or lasting injury.
You were enslaved by drow or mind flayers but escaped to the surface.
You seek only to test yourself in battle with monsters.
Profit is all that matters to you.
The best way to defeat the folk of the surface is to study them firsthand.
table.name: Duergar in the World; Duergar Adventurer Story Hooks

table.caption: Duergar Quirks
rows: A separate personality in your mind provides advice and guidance to you.
Your gear must be perfectly arranged, otherwise someone must bleed.
When there isn't a roof over your head, you keep your eyes on the ground.
You don't talk unless you absolutely must.
The outside world is a giant cave, and nothing will convince you otherwise.
Humans fascinate you, and you collect odd trinkets of their culture.
table.name: Duergar in the World; Duergar Quirks

table.caption: Githyanki Personality Traits
rows: When I'm bored I make my own excitement, and I'm always bored.
I treat others as if they were animals that simply don't know any better.
Violence is a spice that makes life worth living.
Old age is a concept that I find fascinating. Maybe someday I too will be aged.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Personality Traits

table.caption: Githyanki Ideals
rows: Fidelity. Warriors are only as good as the vows they keep.
Power. The weak rule the strong.
Duty. It is by Vlaakith's will alone that I act.
Freedom. No strong soul should be enslaved. Better to die first than live as another's puppet.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Ideals

table.caption: Githyanki Bonds
rows: There is no greater duty than to serve the Revered Queen.
Humanity thrives only because we conquered the illithids. Therefore, what is theirs is ours.
Without battle, life has no purpose.
Life is but a spark in the dark. We all go dark, but those who dare can burn bright.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Bonds

table.caption: Githyanki Flaws
rows: Hunger and thirst are unbearable pains to me.
I can't see a non-githyanki as a real threat.
I follow orders, regardless of their implications.
I start projects but never finish them.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Flaws

table.caption: Githzerai Personality Traits
rows: All energy must be expended to a useful end. Frivolity is the first step to defeat.
Patience in all things. The first step in any venture is the most treacherous.
Emotions are a trap, meant to weaken the intellect and disturb the nerves. Pay them no heed.
Begin only those tasks you will finish. Strike only that which you will kill.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Personality Traits

table.caption: Githzerai Ideals
rows: Faith. Zerthimon shall return, and I will be worthy to walk beside him.
Courage. The mind can master anything if it is unfettered by fear.
Duty. My people survive only because those like me place their needs above our own.
Freedom. No strong soul should be enslaved. Better to die first than live as another's puppet.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Ideals

table.caption: Githzerai Bonds
rows: Zerthimon provides an example of conduct that I strive to duplicate.
Menyar-Ag hand-picked me for my duties, and I will never betray the trust he showed in me.
Vlaakith and her toadies will be defeated, if not by me then by those who follow in my footsteps.
I will not rest until the last elder brain is destroyed.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Bonds

table.caption: Githzerai Flaws
rows: I see githyanki machinations behind every threat.
I believe in the supremacy of the gith and that githzerai and githyanki will align to rule the multiverse.
I respond to even minor threats with overwhelming displays of force.
The next time I laugh will be the first. The sound of merriment takes me to the edge of violence.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Flaws

table.caption: Halfling Personality Traits
rows: You try to start every day with a smile.
Why walk when you can skip?
You make up songs about your friends that praise them for their bravery and intelligence.
You are extremely cautious, always on the lookout for monsters and other dangers.
You always see the bright side of a situation.
You like to collect mementos of your travels.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Personality Traits

table.caption: Halfling Ideals
rows: Courage. You seek to prove that the bravest heart can be contained within the smallest of packages.
Companionship. You're pretty sure you can be friends with anyone or anything.
Hopeful. You will live a life of adventure and have many stories to tell.
Protective. You make sure to shelter the innocent.
Honest. Your mother told you to always tell the truth.
Excitement. Can you steal the sleeping giant's pouch? Of course you can!
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Ideals

table.caption: Halfling Bonds
rows: The safety of your village is worth any sacrifice.
Nothing is more valuable than friendship and family.
You are following your own path through life. No one can tell you what to do.
You have a special heirloom that you never part with.
You won't rob or hurt those who are weaker or less fortunate than you.
No matter how small you may be, you won't back down from a bully.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Bonds

table.caption: Halfling Flaws
rows: You can't resist poking your nose where it doesn't belong.
You are very fidgety. Sitting still is a major challenge.
You can't pass up a good time.
You hate to miss a meal, and become grumpy and illtempered when you must.
You are fascinated by shiny things and can't help "borrowing" them.
You never settle for just one slice when you can have the whole cake.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Flaws

table.caption: Reasons for Adventuring
rows: Peeling taters and herding goats all the time wasn't your cup of tea.
You fell asleep on a raft one day and woke up near a human city. You were so thrilled with the strange sights and tasty food that you never turned back.
What started off as simple pumpkin pillaging from nearby farms turned into your becoming a wandering rogue for hire.
You talked to a nice faerie in the woods, and all of a sudden you were a thousand miles from home.
Your village elder told you so many stories about being a rogue in an adventuring party that you couldn't resist the urge to try doing it yourself.
A friend dared you to jump on the back of a sleeping horse, which turned out to be a pegasus, and your life hasn't slowed down since.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Reasons for Adventuring

table.caption: Gnome Deities
rows: Golden signet ring with six pointed star
footnotes: *Appears in {@i Xanathar's Guide to Everything}
**Appears in {@i Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide}
table.name: Gnome Gods; Gnome Deities

table.caption: Gnome Personality Traits
rows: Once you develop a liking for something, you quickly become obsessed with it.
You live life like a leaf on the breeze, letting it take you where it will.
The world is a miraculous place, and you are fascinated by everything in it.
You study your friends and take notes about how they act, jotting down things they say that interest you.
Your curiosity is so wide-ranging that you sometimes have trouble concentrating on any one thing.
You like to make little objects and creatures out of twigs or bits of metal and give them to friends.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Personality Traits

table.caption: Gnome Ideals
rows: Love. You love little (and big) critters and go out of your way to help them.
Curiosity. You can't stand an unsolved mystery or an unopened door.
Knowledge. You are interested in everything. You never know when what you learn will come in handy.
Compassion. You never turn down a plea for help.
Helpfulness. Whether you see a broken contraption or a broken heart, you have to try to fix it.
Excellence. You strive to be and do the best you can.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Ideals

table.caption: Gnome Bonds
rows: You pledge to bring something of immense value back to your burrow.
Anything of great quality and artisanship is to be protected, respected, and cared for.
Kobolds have caused you and your people nothing but trouble. You will avenge those wrongs.
You are searching for your lost love.
You will recover a keepsake stolen from your clan.
You are willing to take risks to learn about the world.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Bonds

table.caption: Gnome Flaws
rows: You embody the typical absent-minded professor. If you could forget where you put your head, you would.
You prefer to hide during a fight.
There is no difference between what you think and what you say.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Flaws

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Nation.}我致力于恢复贝纳利亚的帝国。
{@b Peace.}只有当战争和纷争停止时，生命才能真正兴旺。
{@b Protection.}我还将保护不那么幸运的人免受富人和强人的蹂躏。
{@b Hope.}世界正在从漫长的绝望中走出来，需要我们能提供的每一丝灵感。
{@b Honor.} 如果我使自己蒙羞，我就会使我的神、我的国家和我的家庭蒙羞。
{@b Solidarity.} 团结起来，我们比我们任何一个人都更强大。
table.name: Heroes of Benalia; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: 我与七大院之一有联系，我把它的利益置于所有其他利益之上。
我在我的星族中的关系比在我的血缘家庭中的关系更密切。
我拥有一件著名祖先使用的武器或盔甲。
我爱上了一个不同大屋的成员。
我相信我是一个失去了的大房子的最后继承人。
我家的产业处于废墟之中，我想重建它。
table.name: Heroes of Benalia; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Benalish Quests
rows: 保卫红铁山脉中的一个采矿定居点，以抵御克鲁克尚克哥布林的袭击。
与赫伦山脉的牛头人建立贸易或谈判条约。
{@action Help}解决两个大院之间的争端。
说服七人议会向七家中的一家派出军事援助。
在一片荒凉的土地上建立贸易殖民地。
在七大院中发现一个叛徒或卡巴尔的崇拜者。
table.name: Benalish Quests

table.caption: Benalish Sites
rows: 国家支持的天使之火教会的一座失落的Sheoltun神庙
一个隐藏的山洞，里面有一个古老的瑟兰人遗物
新贝纳利亚地下深处的一个秘密地下室，在Sheoltun帝国统治时期，这里曾是被取缔的塞拉教会的聚会场所。
一艘失事的菲莱克斯传送门船，早已被自然界所淹没
盐年期间沉入泥潭的城堡遗迹
一片空地上点缀着久远的战争留下的废墟
就在海岸边的一艘沉船
卡利戈沼泽地中的一座废弃的豪宅
一座塞兰大教堂从天空中的位置跌落到地上
table.name: Benalish Sites

table.caption: Benalish Villains
rows: 一个热心的战士想带领军队与凯尔德作战。
一个房子的领导希望他们的房子能提前几年成为最高的房子。
一个多疑的贵族与一个火热的Serran牧师联手，试图从民众中铲除腐败和Cabal的污点，在此过程中许多无辜者受到伤害。
一个头脑发热的阿文要求他们的人民立即获得在七国委员会的代表权。
一个虔诚的贵族试图将整个塞拉教会置于贝纳利什的控制之下，将教会和国家结合成一个神权帝国。
七人委员会的一名成员对另一名成员有长期的怨恨。
卡利戈沼泽地的一个皮肤巫师将附近的地区置于诅咒之下。
一位重要的贵族受到了一位与阴谋集团有联系的顾问的影响，并在不知不觉中推进了阴谋集团的计划。
table.name: Benalish Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Law.} "Law must be upheld. If the knots of order are loosened, chaos will spill through." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b Grace.} "Grace must be preserved. If the strands of Grace are unraveled, its design will be lost, and the people with it." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b Duty.} "Duty must be obeyed. If the frame of Duty is broken, none shall weave life's fabric." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b Reason.} "Reason must be retained. If the web of Reason comes unwoven, madness will escape." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b Truth.} "Truth must be set free. If the wings of Truth are clipped, the voices will fall silent." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b The Four Virtues.} Art, discourse, freedom, and peace are the life of the spirit, as the spirit is the life of the body.
table.name: Heroes of Serra; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I would do anything to protect the Cathedral of Serra at Sursi.
I have sworn to aid Lyra Dawnbringer in protecting Benalia.
I make regular pilgrimages to the Temple of Serra at Epityr in New Argive, the oldest active Serran worship site in the world.
I preserve many of the old traditions of the Daru nomads or the aven, revering Serra as the Ancestor.
A lesser angel has become a close friend and confidante to me.
I think the stained glass in my holy symbol came from Serra's Realm before that artificial plane's collapse. Invoke the Divine Magali Villeneuve
table.name: Heroes of Serra; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Serran Quests
rows: Act as an impartial mediator between Benalia and Keld (or two other powers of the region).
Tame a mesa pegasus from the lands of Sursi on the east coast of southern Aerona, near the great Cathedral of Serra.
Protect a peaceful community of Serran monks who have come under attack (from without or within).
Answer the call of a barbarian chieftain who wants to hear the message of Serra and consider conversion.
Find an angel who has disappeared in a dangerous land.
Retrieve as much artwork as possible from a ruined Serran church—whether an ancient site or one that was only recently destroyed.
table.name: Serran Quests

table.caption: Serran Sites
rows: A majestic Serran cathedral floating in the air (perhaps above Benalia City)
A small monastery surrounded by pastoral farmland or quiet woods
A remote temple maintained and inhabited by an order of knights
An ancient ruin preserving some foreign aspect of Serra worship (such as Otarian devotion to the Ancestor)
A sacred cave where a new angel was (or is about to be) birthed
An abandoned missionary post destroyed by hostile natives of the area
A chapel within a castle or palace beset by intrigue
A roadside shrine where miracles have occurred lately
A community devoted to the spiritual path of the artistic life
The scorched site of an angel's death
table.name: Serran Sites

table.caption: Serran Villains
rows: A Serran priest believes that no one is beyond redemption, and is shielding a murderous villain from the law in the hope that they will repent.
A naive angel keeps sending Serran knights on deadly quests against impossible odds.
An aven priest wants to lead other aven away from the Serran church and revive the worship of the Ancestor, but without the accretion of Serran tradition.
A warrior chieftain claims to have converted to Serra worship and launches a crusade in the church's name—but this is a thinly veiled excuse to conquer a neighboring territory.
A Serra angel has been corrupted by the demonic power of the Cabal.
A community of Serran monks has been somehow led astray into the contemplation of an ancient, nameless evil.
An old priest grows bitter with grief and frustration, convinced that their life's work has been a waste—and turns to the pursuit of revenge.
A priest twists the teachings of Serra to paint a certain group of innocent people as evil, and to call for their extermination.
table.name: Serran Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
colLabels: Ideal 1 Teaching. Tolaria is a school where the world's most promising wizards can learn from masters of their craft.
rows: {@b Restoration.} Every day, lost knowledge is regained and devastated lands are renewed. It's our duty to use our magic to help this effort continue.
{@b Responsibility.} Following the philosophy of the Academy's original headmaster, Barrin, I am dedicated to keeping powerful magic out of the hands of those who would abuse it.
{@b Innovation.} Like the ancient artificer Urza, I believe progress comes through bold and radical new design.
{@b Progress.} Like the kind Tolarian chancellor Rayne, I believe progress comes through careful iteration and measured experimentation.
{@b Self-Improvement.} Like Urza's brother Mishra, I believe that the improvement of the body through genetic and artificial modification leads to the general improvement of humanity.
table.name: Heroes of Tolaria; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I have a former student I'm convinced will do great things—for good or for evil.
I bought a cheap curio from a secondhand store, and I was expelled when it caused a magical accident.
I've gotten tangled up with illegal research by way of the Shadow Academy, which uses interdimensional spaces to facilitate communication.
By virtue of a parent who is emeritus faculty, I have the rare privilege of citizenship in one of the Academies.
One of my old teachers has a knack for contacting me at the strangest times.
I believe that my genetic makeup was manipulated for some unknown purpose.
table.name: Heroes of Tolaria; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Tolarian Quests
rows: Retrieve a unique magical device from the ruins of a catastrophe—but be careful, because the device might well have been what caused the catastrophe.
Copy a spell from the spellbook of a mysterious or hostile wizard.
Find a way to reverse the effect of a disastrous magical experiment.
Decide what to do with a notebook you found, which is full of forbidden research into Phyrexian transformation.
Steal a magical object that's on display in a museum on campus in order to uncover its secrets or harness the energy it holds.
Try to reproduce the research of a wizard who has gone missing, without ending up missing yourself.
table.name: Tolarian Quests

table.caption: Tolarian Sites
rows: An underwater ruin left behind by a terrible catastrophe
The trap-filled tower of an eccentric, suspicious, and powerful wizard
An arcane workshop or laboratory filled with inexplicable and undoubtedly dangerous devices
A laboratory where research was once conducted—or still is conducted—on living monsters
A small stronghold drifting through the air or across the ocean
A library hidden in an extradimensional space
An ancient Phyrexian or Thran artifact, now overgrown by nature
A crater where a meteorite or a flying vessel crashed to the ground centuries ago
A newly discovered ruin from an ancient era of advanced magical technology
An area that has just returned after being phased out of the flow of time
table.name: Tolarian Sites

table.caption: Tolarian Villains
rows: A member of the Society of Mishra seeks to be transformed into a biomechanical demon of fused metal and flesh.
A Gathist involved in illegal genetic experimentation seeks to create a race of supersoldiers to forge a nation through conquest.
A collector steals magical items and treats them like valuable works of art.
A professor of temporal studies seeks to hasten the process of rebirth and renewal—by shifting the entire world backward in time to its "glory days."
An archaeologist has discovered an ancient magical weapon that caused untold devastation, and is trying to find a use for it.
A professor has imprisoned students in a tower and compelled them to participate in genetic, biomechanical, psychological, or other research.
An artificer built a golem that has achieved its own evil consciousness, and which seeks to better understand living creatures through vivisection.
A misguided master wizard is trying to trace a single "true Tolarian ancestry," so as to prevent those who don't belong to that human bloodline from entering the Academies and studying magic.
table.name: Tolarian Villains

table.caption: Vodalian Quests
rows: Retrieve an artifact from ancient Vodalia that is kept in a Tolarian museum.
Sabotage a Cabal port on Walassa, where ships set sail for Aerona carrying Cabal cultists.
Protect a peripatetic member of the Society of the Conch on a journey to learn about your native culture.
Defend a surface port loyal to Vodalia from a land-based attack.
Find a pirate captain who slaughtered a group of merfolk, but who has not been seen in the Voda Sea since.
Retrieve an item of historical significance from a Keldon fortress.
table.name: Vodalian Quests

table.caption: Vodalian Sites
rows: A shipwreck on the ocean floor
A surface-built city that sank in a magical catastrophe
A city built on the back of an enormous leviathan
A palace in a coral reef
A ship crossing the Voda Sea
A well-preserved Thran or Phyrexian artifact deep underwater
A sea cave on an island shore
A beach where merfolk trade with surface-dwellers
table.name: Vodalian Sites

table.caption: Vodalian Villains
rows: A hotheaded young military officer, part of the Akula Current, plans to escalate conflict with a surface port in hopes of eventually annexing the port.
A notable aristocrat decides that no ships may cross their territory—and sinks a merchant vessel to emphasize the point.
A mage manipulates coastal waters, causing saltwater to back up rivers, beachfront land to flood, and docks to be swept away by the waves.
A group of merfolk turn to piracy, angering both surface-dwellers and other merfolk.
A trickster lures sailors into shipwrecks, then either takes them captive or watches them drown.
A spellcaster calls up horrific monsters from the ocean depths to attack a coastal town.
A general's crusade against homarids is driving those creatures into human-occupied coastal lands.
A wizard seeks the Golgothian Sylex—the artifact that destroyed the island of Argoth and launched the ice age—in hopes of destroying all land on Dominaria.
table.name: Vodalian Villains

table.caption: Cabal Sites
rows: A small shrine to Belzenlok located near a major city
A basement room in a busy town where Cabal cultists meet
A ruined library that cultists are excavating, hoping to find magic items to decorate Belzenlok's throne
A half-collapsed temple in a dark swamp
An ancient war machine whose power the Cabal is trying to harness
A small outpost of Grimnant knights
A deep sinkhole with whispering echoes emerging from the darkness
A secret fortress in the mountains
The house of an aristocrat who has joined the Cabal
table.name: Cabal Sites

table.caption: Cabal Villains
rows: A Grimnant commander leads raids along a nation's borders to sow chaos and confusion.
A Cabal assassin starts killing the firstborn children of prominent families.
A dementist unleashes formless horrors of nightmare upon a defenseless town.
A cult leader sends a miasma out from a hidden temple to pollute and corrupt the surrounding forest.
A Cabal cultist has infiltrated a ruling council or prominent church body and begins destroying it from within.
A dementist is controlling the mind of a monster, sending it to rampage through an area of farms and villages.
A Cabal infiltrator sows discord among various factions within a larger organization (different Serran orders, different Benalish houses, and so forth).
Cabal infiltrators detonate nightmare devices designed to cause as much terror as possible, striking in highly populated areas at unpredictable times.
table.name: Cabal Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Self-Reliance.} I don't wear or use anything I haven't made myself. You can't count on anyone else in this world.
{@b Future.} I believe a true Twilight still awaits the Keldon faithful, when our fallen heroes will rise up to fight alongside us as we conquer the world.
{@b Pragmatism.} No ancestors are coming to save us—we are our only hope.
{@b Coin.} I will happily fight for those too weak to defend themselves, if they pay me enough.
{@b Freedom.} The so-called "new Keld" is too safe, too controlled. The fire in Keldon blood demands warfare and pillage.
{@b Keld.} I am Keldon, and that is all that matters. I seek the glory and prosperity of my people above all else.
table.name: Bard or Cleric; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I fight to prove myself worthy of my glorious ancestors.
Even away from Keld, my loyalty is to my warlord and the rest of my warhost.
I'm inexplicably drawn to the sacred peak called the Mountain.
My favorite weapon is one I forged from the broken weapons of my enemies.
I want to be a warlord someday, and I won't stop there.
I had a dear mentor from another nation who taught me my skills.
table.name: Bard or Cleric; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Keld Quests
rows: Persuade a Benalish house to abandon a colony newly established on Keld's soil.
Carry an urgent message from one warlord to another across a dangerous area.
Convince a wayward warlord to obey an overseer's orders before the situation escalates into full-on rebellion.
Undermine the loyalty of a rebellious warlord's warhost, thus depriving the warlord of power.
Kill a monster lurking in the mountains.
Fend off attacks by frost giants from the north.
table.name: Keld Quests

table.caption: Keld Sites
rows: At the foot of the Keldons' sacred Mountain
At the entrance to the Keldon Necropolis, where great figures of the past are interred
A tower formed from strange black ice
A forest clearing where the air is cold enough to freeze your breath in your mouth
A plateau where carved megaliths are erected
A camp with dozens of round tents
At the peak of the Keldons' sacred Mountain
table.name: Keld Sites

table.caption: Keld Villains
rows: A warlord leads an attack on a different warhost.
A doyen advises several different warlords to provoke conflicts with Benalia, believing that a full-scale war will trigger the true Twilight.
A shaman has secretly made an alliance with the frost giants of the northern wastes to help overthrow the grand warlord.
A shaman dabbles in the hated arts of necromancy, hoping to reproduce the false Twilight caused by the Phrexians.
A frost giant shaman brings a nightmarish winter down over Keld, and it begins spreading farther south.
A warlord leads a host in longboats to the Benalish isle of Avenant.
A warlord directly challenges the authority of the grand warlord, hoping to take her place.
A warlord kills the grand warlord and starts transforming Keld back into the land of bloodthirsty raiders it once was.
table.name: Keld Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Riashil Pacifism.} To live at peace with nature, we must first learn to live at peace with each other.
{@b Staprion Defiance.} Those who cross lines must be put in their place.
{@b Loridalh Interdependence.} I am my own master, but I am strongest when I work as part of the web of all life.
{@b Kelfae Flexibility.} The search for stability—whether in a swaying treetop or in the turmoil of life—is fruitless.
{@b Jubilar Remembrance.} The sacrifice of those who were exterminated in the Phyrexian Invasion must be remembered, and their stories retold.
{@b Basiphem Pride.} Because we are strong, it is our responsibility to aid the rest of the forest where we can.
{@b Hedressel Holiness.} We must maintain our distance—culturally and physically—from other peoples to maintain our connections to the wood.
{@b Ruadach Openness.} We must open ourselves to new cultures, new peoples, and new ideas, or we will rot like a fallen log.
table.name: Fighter or Ranger; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I could always count on my mother to give me a good bonk on the head if I did something foolish. (Riashil)
I will have my revenge against the Cabal for the harm they have done to my kin. (Staprion)
One of the twelve tallest emergent trees in Llanowar is the dearest place to me in all the world. (Loridalh)
I was bonded to a kavu at birth. (Kelfae)
I survived the Phyrexian Invasion over three hundred years ago, and I will never forget the faces of those who died. (Jubilar)
My family carries the shame of failing to protect Llanowar from the Phyrexian Invasion, and I will stop at nothing to undo that shame. (Basiphem)
I spent a year in Hedressel, and I would give my life to defend that holy place. (Hedressel)
I left my family rather than endure the grief of losing them. (Ruadach)
table.name: Fighter or Ranger; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Llanowar Quests
rows: Find the source of orc raids in the Ironcrown Mountains.
Retrieve something caught in the web of an enormous spider.
Carry a message to a Benalish city—about diplomacy, trade, matters of the heart, or anything else.
Track down an interloper who managed to escape punishment for crimes against the forest (perhaps even trespassing in Hedressel).
Dispose of a newly uncovered piece of Phyrexian wreckage.
Plant a seed from Llanowar in the Whispering Woods or another distant forest.
table.name: Llanowar Quests

table.caption: Llanowar Sites
rows: Inside a giant tree that has strangely begun to rot from the inside
At the top of an emergent tree, where magical flowers grow
Nestled among the roots of one of the oldest and largest trees in the forest
A temple hollowed out from a huge branch of a still-living tree
A statue of the elf hero Eladamri, situated in the middle of a placid forest clearing
A network of rope bridges connecting canopy trees
A sinister-looking tower made from a dead tree
An enormous patch of mushrooms that gets larger every day
An anthill, termite nest, or wasp nest that's larger than a grand temple
table.name: Llanowar Sites

table.caption: Llanowar Villains
rows: A zealous druid wants to drive the humans and half-elves out of Ruadach.
A pragmatist thinks the old druidic traditions are holding the elves back from greatness, and seeks to destroy Hedressel or Molimo (or both).
A knight of the Steel Leaf tries to stir up war with Benalia, in order to have an excuse to slaughter the humans.
A druid uses ancient necromancy to poison a stream supplying water to a Benalish town.
A Staprion warrior believes the pacifist Riashil are traitors to the elves, and tries to goad them into fighting.
An elf has bred a giant kavu intended to topple trees and destroy elfhames.
A necromancer wants to use the spirits of the elven dead that are said to guard Hedressel to destroy the elves entirely.
A leader of the Order of the Steel Leaf is in league with the Cabal, and tries to undermine the Staprion offensive against that order.
table.name: Llanowar Villains

table.caption: Party Makeup
rows: {@b One-Guild Party}. 选择一个公会，并参考其在{@book chapter 2|GGR|2}中的描述，以获得围绕该公会建立聚会的建议。
{@b Classic Party}. 波罗或塞勒斯尼亚教士（生命领域），阿佐留斯或波罗战士（冠军原型），迪米尔或戈尔加里游侠（盗贼原型），波罗或伊泽特巫师（召唤学院）
{@b Law and Order Party}. 波罗教士, 阿佐里乌斯战士, 阿佐里乌斯巫师, 波罗游侠
{@b Mad Science Party}. 西米克德鲁伊, 伊泽特战士, 伊泽特巫师, 西米克僧侣
{@b Skulkers Party}. 戈尔加里德鲁伊、戈尔加里战士或游侠、迪米尔游侠或僧侣、迪米尔巫师
{@b Chaos Party}. 格鲁尔德鲁伊, 格鲁尔野蛮人, {@creature Rakdos|GGR} 术士, {@creature Rakdos|GGR} 流氓
{@b Nature Party}. 塞勒斯尼亚德鲁伊, 格鲁尔野蛮人, 西米克巫师或塞勒斯尼亚吟游诗人, 戈尔加里游侠
{@b Benevolent Party}. 塞勒斯尼亚教士, 波洛斯圣骑士, 阿佐里乌斯魔法师, 塞勒斯尼亚吟游诗人
table.name: Building a Party; Party Makeup

table.caption: Common Cause
rows: {@b Cellmates}. 人物是阿佐里斯监狱、格鲁尔营地或{@creature Rakdos|GGR}牢笼中的囚犯。
{@b Greater Threat}. 角色们正在互相厮杀，这时一只横冲直撞的巫妖来袭。
{@b Sudden Danger}. 由于天坑开裂、建筑物倒塌或实验室爆炸，人物被困在一起。
{@b Dream Team}. 一个奇怪的梦将每个人物引向同一个目的地。
{@b Lost Together}. 人物在城市的一个不熟悉的地方无望地迷失了方向。
{@b Detente}. 根据他们行会领导人的命令，这些角色必须合作完成一项秘密任务。
{@b Common Foe}. 恶棍是所有角色的共同敌人。
{@b Do or Die}. 这些人物都在努力避免各行会之间全面战争的灾难。
